info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 27 at 3:09AM CDT until March 27 at 5:15AM CDT by NWS Brownsville TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of Deep South Texas, including the following county, Cameron.
* WHEN...Until 515 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 308 AM CDT, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in Port Isabel due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Port Isabel and South Padre Island are the most likely places to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... South Padre Island, Port Isabel High School, Laguna Heights, Laguna Vista Police Department, South Padre Island Convention Center, South Padre Island Birding Center, Port Isabel City Hall, Port Isabel Lighthouse, Port Isabel Fire And Police Department, Beach Access Four, Garria Elementary School, South Padre Island Police Department, Washington Park, Beach Access Five, Holly Beach, Beach Access Six, U.s. Coast Guard Station, Port Isabel--Laguna Heights and Port Isabel Library. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING
